page.title: 13Forestry Tavistock Woodlands
page.content: {Tavistock Woodlands}is an area of forestry of approximately{1000 {hectares owned by the Earl of {Bradford.}It employs a total of{47 {men.}The main species of trees grown are{Douglas Fir, Western Hemlock and {Western Red Cedar.}About{70,000 {seedlings are planted each year}to replace trees cut down (about 250 per day). These are obtained mainly from Huntley, Gloucestershire, and Washington,U.S.A.{These take at least {55 years to reach maturity.}The wood is used to make fences, gates and tables and these are sold to local builders and farmers. The waste wood is sold for firewood. Safety precautions are very stringent,{hard {hats and suits of 40 layers of nylon {are worn to prevent accidents.
